column17: The attack took place the Sai Yeung Choi Street South and Shantung Streets of Mong Kok district, Hong Kong.
column18: 12/13/2008: On Saturday evening, at 1700, two large plastic bottles carrying acid were hurled into the Sai Yeung Choi Street South and Shantung Streets of Mong Kok district, Hong Kong.  A reported 46 persons were injured in the attack. The bottles were reportedly thrown from above. The two white bottles, each with a capacity of about 750ml, were kicked by pedestrians after they landed, making it more difficult to determine from where they had been thrown. Police officers with shields and helmets searched the Chung Kiu Commercial Building and other buildings near the scene, but five hours after the attack they had still not found any suspects. The injured had been treated in a hospital and had been released by 2200. No group claimed responsibility.
column64: The specific motive for the attack is unknown.
column97: Two bottles containing 750 ml of Acid were used in the attack.
column108: The civilians clothes and bag items were damaged in the attack.
column127: \"\"46 Hurt in Hong Kong Acid Attack"
column131: \"\"Dozens of Christmas Shoppers Hurt as Bottles of Acid Rain Down"
